commit_message:
target link was being created incorrectly

If the target symbolic link already existed, an invalid link in target
was created to java/target. Fixed by checking if the link exists before
creating it

Change-Id: If0ab57bfd8989f7c9d0facd8d1e8b9aaa98bc578

added_lines: set -x if [ ! -L target ]; then ln -sf java/target target fi

commit_message:
target link was being created incorrectly

If the target symbolic link already existed, an invalid link in target
was created to java/target. Fixed by checking if the link exists before
creating it

Change-Id: I3ebcdcf0de1412838d78a2d2e647e265c41502e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-persister refs/changes/38/215238/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ ! -L target ]; then ln -sf java/target target fi

commit_message:
Fixes loops for bashate

The 'do' is expected to be on the same line as the 'for' or 'while' in a
loop declaration.

commit_message:
Port NetApp DATAONTAP blocks drivers to ABC model

This commit modifies the NetApp DATAONTAP iSCSI and FibreChannel
volume drivers to the new ABC driver model.

Change-Id: I1a75c0e10ec5a241068cf4c28199a57da7fc2974
Partially-implements: blueprint abc-driver-update

commit_message:
qos: Delete bw limit rule when policy is deleted

We need to add ON DELETE CASCADE to qos_policy_id on bw limit rule table
in order to delete policy successfully. There is a migration script that
creates db scheme with correct foreign key constraint but we miss this in
models. Currently, we have a functional test that guarantees parity
between migration scripts and models but we don't have guaranteed foreign
keys parity due to alembic bug [1].

https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/alembic/issues/317

Change-Id: I06fa32dd11a5a52a80ae5a7952f8b32511c3f39d
Closes-Bug: 1485926

commit_message:
Inconsistent flavor type fix in 'Getting started' chapter for firstapp.

In 'Flavors and images' section, different flavor was suggested in text
and different used in command. Bug fixed for libcloud, dotnet and pkgcloud SDKs.

Change-Id: I69cb5e92eee56190f32a11f75325daf05d37462c

commit_message:
Remove accepting complex type values

Python complex type can have imaginary numbers
with values such as 5j which we do not want to
accept
Change-Id: If7f67e65cab229cee46bd94ae6da5eb7c2f0c3c9

commit_message:
Allow individual failures to not block provision

This change set allows for an individual port request to not block the
remaining provision requests.

This change set also backs off on the mark_up/down methods as the
refactoring indicated that they were a bit more hassle than they were
worth.

Change-Id: I89d62548a87cb6d9da1e8d9f9ccf77f044977dee

commit_message:
Improve provision VLAN performance

The VLAN provisioning performance can be sped up by querying only for
the CNAs of the VM that the request is for.  The device_id can be used
for this data - as that matches the nova instance UUID.

This is valuable in scenarios where there are hundreds of VMs on the
system.  Rather than having every request query the entire system, this
change allows us to only get the data that we need for the request that
comes in.

This change required bundling together data from both the neutron port
and the device detail.  As such, a new entity called NetworkDevice was
added that pulls together these two pieces of information.

Change-Id: I0a4a7cd2a2f3681598aec368ddd4d6c0366654b5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-powervm refs/changes/94/214694/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Is a list of NetworkDevice objects. :param dev: neutron_powervm NetworkDevice to find a match for return self.br_map.get(dev.physical_network), dev.segmentation_id
deleted_lines: self.mac_address = dev.get('mac_address') self.pvid = dev.get('segmentation_id') # Get all the Client Network Adapters once up front, as it can be # expensive. client_adpts = utils.list_cnas(self.adapter, self.host_uuid) cna = utils.find_cna_for_mac(request.mac_address, client_adpts) utils.update_cna_pvid(cna, request.pvid) LOG.debug("Sending update device for %s" % request.mac_address) self.agent.update_device_up(request.dev) {'pvid': request.pvid, 'mac': request.mac_address}) self.agent.update_device_down(request.dev) return {x.pvid for x in self.requests} :param devices: The new devices that are to be provisioned. Is a set of neutron devices (from the device_details). :param dev: Neutron device to find a match for return self.br_map.get(dev.get('physical_network')),\ dev.get('segmentation_id')

commit_message:
Ensure that nova and neutron provide consistent DHCP domain values

This patch adds the dhcp_domain config entry to nova.conf and
implements group_vars to default both nova and neutron's dhcp
domain values to be the same.

The individual values can still be overridden in user_variables
by using nova_dhcp_domain or neutron_dhcp_domain, but it's expected
that deployers would like these to be consistent.

Change-Id: I97beb78f62aeca2665ff72805056d36ead2adaaa
Closes-Bug: #1482045
(cherry picked from commit 7427775201bc17e0dd7bf3dafe96263eb3b916d3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/50/215650/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-21 13:37:36.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_cinder/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/hosts.yml', 'playbooks/os-cinder-install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/eecf311e3fe2e45be89d29cf3fbc5f75210638ae', 'message': 'Set lxc.autodev=0 for cinder_volumes in containers

With cinder_volumes we were creating a specific udev device, this will
fail to mount if lxc.autodev=1. This should only be required when lvm is
a backend for the cinder_volumes container.

We can specify lxc.autodev=0 for cinder_volumes containers. To do this
properly we first check if lvm is in use. We can also use this to ensure
that redundant "lvm" configuration isn't setup on volumes hosts with no
lvm backend.

Additionally this will fix the formatting on the "udev" lxc.mount.entry
as it was adding additional spaces.

Change-Id: Iabe72003ebcfefe11d360131fdde64ca4b21a192
Closes-Bug: #1483650
(cherry picked from commit e85592d54cacd521efb30ac373693bb1e9425c1b)
'}]
commit_message:
Set lxc.autodev=0 for cinder_volumes in containers

With cinder_volumes we were creating a specific udev device, this will
fail to mount if lxc.autodev=1. This should only be required when lvm is
a backend for the cinder_volumes container.

We can specify lxc.autodev=0 for cinder_volumes containers. To do this
properly we first check if lvm is in use. We can also use this to ensure
that redundant "lvm" configuration isn't setup on volumes hosts with no
lvm backend.

Additionally this will fix the formatting on the "udev" lxc.mount.entry
as it was adding additional spaces.

Change-Id: Iabe72003ebcfefe11d360131fdde64ca4b21a192
Closes-Bug: #1483650
(cherry picked from commit e85592d54cacd521efb30ac373693bb1e9425c1b)

commit_message:
Add support for additional nova.conf options

The following options have been added to improve support for rbd (Ceph)
in nova.

libvirt/hw_disk_discard = unmap
www.sebastien-han.fr/blog/2015/02/02/openstack-and-ceph-rbd-discard

libvirt/disk_cachemodes = "network=writeback"
www.sebastien-han.fr/blog/2013/08/22/configure-rbd-caching-on-nova

http://ceph.com/docs/master/rbd/rbd-openstack/

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint ceph-block-devices
Change-Id: Ibf717fa88326805254ca31421d9a77c47b326b67
(cherry picked from commit c8b133e025a270202e6cc7f11c286f557362f37a)

subject: Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-06 11:06:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tempest/commit/347ce50e112bef46c6d7aca59f30caa14d33b63c', 'message': "Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in tempest_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

tempest_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

tempest_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  tempest_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  tempest_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

tempest_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

tempest_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: Idb64253273ef5a1e4bc0311e1d5bb265a820b9b7

commit_message:
Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in tempest_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

tempest_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

tempest_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  tempest_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  tempest_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

tempest_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

tempest_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: Idb64253273ef5a1e4bc0311e1d5bb265a820b9b7
Depends-On: I0eeebde3aac2662cc7e69bfad7f8d2481463a218
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tempest refs/changes/79/209879/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: newvalues(/^[\S ]*$/) newparam(:ensure_absent_val) do desc 'A value that is specified as the value property will behave as if ensure => absent was specified' defaultto('<SERVICE DEFAULT>')
deleted_lines: newparam(:path) do desc 'The ini file Puppet will ensure contains the specified setting.' validate do |value| unless (Puppet.features.posix? and value =~ /^\//) or (Puppet.features.microsoft_windows? and (value =~ /^.:\// or value =~ /^\/\/[^\/]+\/[^\/]+/)) raise(Puppet::Error, "File paths must be fully qualified, not '#{value}'") end end

commit_message:
Use config rather than hardcoded admin id from Quotas test

Rather than use hardcoded 'admin' userid, get the
userid in the setUp() method in QuotasTestCase from the config
(CONF.identity.username).

Change-Id: I4c5ab05a9a55f9f9a093a0ff60f6793337863aa6
Closes-Bug: #1485762
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/60/213860/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from functionaltests.common import config CONF = config.get_config() self.project_id = self.behaviors.get_project_id_from_name( CONF.identity.username)

commit_message:
Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in designate_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

designate_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

designate_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  designate_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  designate_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

designate_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

designate_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-06 11:06:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-trove/commit/28c23566b7301aa5e5a9cd197f31d32d83d44567', 'message': "Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in trove_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

trove_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

trove_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  trove_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  trove_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

trove_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

trove_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

commit_message:
Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in trove_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

The same apply for trove_conductor_config, trove_guestagent_config and
trove_taskmanager_config

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

trove_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

trove_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  trove_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  trove_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

trove_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

trove_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: I44472b107c951d22932c533031f68aa67a5f2e18
Depends-On: I0eeebde3aac2662cc7e69bfad7f8d2481463a218
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-trove refs/changes/80/209880/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper_acceptance' describe 'basic trove_config resource' do context 'default parameters' do it 'should work with no errors' do pp= <<-EOS Exec { logoutput => 'on_failure' } File <||> -> Keystone_config <||> file { '/etc/trove' : ensure => directory, } file { '/etc/trove/trove.conf' : ensure => file, } trove_config { 'DEFAULT/thisshouldexist' : value => 'foo', } trove_config { 'DEFAULT/thisshouldnotexist' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>', } trove_config { 'DEFAULT/thisshouldexist2' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>', ensure_absent_val => 'toto', } trove_config { 'DEFAULT/thisshouldnotexist2' : value => 'toto', ensure_absent_val => 'toto', } EOS # Run it twice and test for idempotency apply_manifest(pp, :catch_failures => true) apply_manifest(pp, :catch_changes => true) end describe file('/etc/trove/trove.conf') do it { should exist } it { should contain('thisshouldexist=foo') } it { should contain('thisshouldexist2=<SERVICE DEFAULT>') } its(:content) { should_not match /thisshouldnotexist/ } end end end

subject: Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-16 11:46:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/c6ae424df0fd1fe8606a415250e2507c4c202bc0', 'message': "Reflect provider change in openstacklib

With the creation of the new provider openstack_config, some processing
that was done here is now moved there.

Also this commit adds the `ensure_absent_val` that lets one specify which
value will mean `ensure => absent` for the keystone_config provider. It
defaults to 'nil'.

The use cases are the following :

keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => nil } # will mean absent

Keystone_config {
  ensure_absent_val => 'nolose',
}
keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'nolose' } # will mean absent

Change-Id: I7c880518f0323e44e7c72f0ff5548482a0b1413c
Depends-On: I061371d8cf2faf928019161e635e1b4252a6b433

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in keystone_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

commit_message:
Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in keystone_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

keystone_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: I7c880518f0323e44e7c72f0ff5548482a0b1413c
Depends-On: I0eeebde3aac2662cc7e69bfad7f8d2481463a218
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/13/202513/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :parent => Puppet::Type.type(:openstack_config).provider(:ini_setting)
deleted_lines: :parent => Puppet::Type.type(:ini_setting).provider(:ruby) def section resource[:name].split('/', 2).first end def setting resource[:name].split('/', 2).last end def separator '=' end # added for backwards compatibility with older versions of inifile def file_path self.class.file_path end

Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in gnocchi_config has been centralized in

Impacted methods are :

  * section

  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string

} else {

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: Ie8dce6e9d4c1027bd1f7d8653a4fa6fe28b696d9

commit_message:
Fix the peer review link in the 'Patches and Reviews' policy section

The old peer code review wiki has been replaced by the infra dev manual
for peer review, so update the link in our docs.

Change-Id: Ib84e2e10e32a2328d9252c86b539b1b40830761d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/56/212056/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: For review guidelines see: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#peer-review

that was done in monasca_config has been centralized in

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

monasca_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

monasca_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

}

a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

monasca_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

commit_message:
Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in monasca_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

This also applies for agent_config.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

monasca_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

monasca_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  monasca_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  monasca_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

monasca_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

monasca_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: I7b1ced3f5e2d3e9b685a4ae4122f83bea73bc877
Depends-On: I0eeebde3aac2662cc7e69bfad7f8d2481463a218
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-monasca refs/changes/74/209874/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :parent => Puppet::Type.type(:openstack_config).provider(:ini_setting)
deleted_lines: :parent => Puppet::Type.type(:ini_setting).provider(:ruby) def section resource[:name].split('/', 2).first end def setting resource[:name].split('/', 2).last end def separator '=' end # added for backwards compatibility with older versions of inifile def file_path self.class.file_path end

commit_message:
Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in swift_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

swift_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

swift_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  swift_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  swift_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

swift_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

swift_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: I9281d2cae81f9799327f7f6e04498d6bc723f233
Depends-On: I0eeebde3aac2662cc7e69bfad7f8d2481463a218
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/78/209878/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: desc 'Section/setting name to manage from swift.conf' newvalues(/^[\S ]*$/) newparam(:ensure_absent_val) do desc 'A value that is specified as the value property will behave as if ensure => absent was specified' defaultto('<SERVICE DEFAULT>')
deleted_lines: desc 'Section/setting name to manage from /etc/swift/swift.conf' # Require the swift.conf to be present autorequire(:file) do ['/etc/swift/swift.conf']

"}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-19 09:03:02.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/ironic_config.rb', 'spec/unit/provider/ironic_config/ini_setting_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/ironic_config/ini_setting.rb', 'README.md'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic/commit/bb1bab5b2832b433111fde3dc574ebb8ff37e804', 'message': "Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in ironic_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

ironic_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

ironic_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  ironic_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  ironic_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

ironic_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

ironic_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: I35ddb5c9f90cb5c65ceca64abf1c4881e4216554
Depends-On: I0eeebde3aac2662cc7e69bfad7f8d2481463a218
"}]
commit_message:
Reflect provider change in puppet-openstacklib

With the creation of the new openstack_config provider, some processing
that was done in ironic_config has been centralized in
openstack_config.

Impacted methods are :

  * section
  * setting
  * separator

Also, this commit adds the fact that, when passing a specific string
(ensure_absent_val) the provider will behave as if ensure => absent was
specified. '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' is the default value for
ensure_absent_val.

The use case is the following :

ironic_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => 'bar' } # will work as usual

ironic_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' } # will mean absent

That means that all the current :

if $myvar {
  ironic_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }
} else {
  ironic_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : ensure => absent }
}

can be removed in favor of :

ironic_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => $myvar }

If for any reason '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' turns out to be a valid value for
a specific parameter. One could by pass that doing the following :

ironic_config { 'DEFAULT/foo' : value => '<SERVICE DEFAULT>',
ensure_absent_val => 'foo' }

Change-Id: I35ddb5c9f90cb5c65ceca64abf1c4881e4216554
Depends-On: I0eeebde3aac2662cc7e69bfad7f8d2481463a218

commit_message:
target link was being created incorrectly

If the target symbolic link already existed, an invalid link in target
was created to java/target. Fixed by checking if the link exists before
creating it

Change-Id: Ie53f396820e0e0022a949799b2b433b5ae11c4d1

commit_message:
Allow nova key/partition/password injection

This commit adds the following new variables to customise whether nova
will allow key/partition/password injection:

nova_libvirt_inject_key
nova_libvirt_inject_partition
nova_libvirt_inject_password

Additionally, the following variable has been added to allow setting
password via Horizon:

horizon_can_set_password

Lastly, password injection can now be tested with tempest via:

tempest_compute_change_password

Note that all variables have been defaulted to their current values.

Closes-Bug: #1469238

Change-Id: Iff434ed7c042f7990990485c34d0f35b9a7baa7a
(cherry picked from commit 5a3d5afa0f3be283a7bcde88361b77e32eaf5c10)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/25/215625/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tempest_compute_change_password: False

commit_message:
Use slurp to get the content of the ceph.conf file

Using slurp will copy the original file entirely, the command strips
new lines at the end of the file and ceph complain when \n on the last
line is missing.

Implements: blueprint ceph-block-devices

Change-Id: I321071fad9af332243a86f5840399e3363dfb37a
(cherry picked from commit a3d94f7e0dc37020234a4e57cda44d5819c73922)

commit_message:
Fix MariaDB for ubuntu

In MariaDB we adjust the dependecies of what we install there as well
adding only what is appropriate for the install.

In Ansible we adjust some templates to all work around differences
between the different Linux families.

Change-Id: Ibc26e2f4d4a732630632d3ed27fb595b6fe019d2
Partially-Implements: blueprint install-from-ubuntu

commit_message:
Add docs-on-rtfd to auto-publish docs

Right now, the os-ansible-deployment project doesn't have automatically
published docs, and we're waiting on a project rename and move before
pushing to the openstack.org docs location.

Primarily, we have submitted for the project to go from
'stackforge/os-ansible-deployment' to 'openstack/openstack-ansible'.
Since this is not just a namespace move but also a project rename, we're
holding off on a docs.openstack.org job to reduce any potential
conflict. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/191105/ for more
information.

This change allows us to automatically build to readthedocs.org in the
meantime.

Change-Id: I9df80688ac18385c0fcef7628a0e8fc7265545c8

commit_message:
Add custom code to base docker templates

Sometimes you need custom code in Docerfiles to solve for example
proxy problems or preconfigure base image in some specific way.
With this commit you can insert content of custom file to the beggining
of base Dockerfile to provide these changes

Partially-implements: bp rhel-based-image-support
Partially-implements: bp add-proxy-to-dockerfiles
Partially-implements: bp build-script
Change-Id: Idbfec764aad627f5c00dc09c4854d5fa1c5ac9cf

commit_message:
Fix 033 add encryption unique key migration

SQLite doesn't support 'drop constraint' statament. So it notifies:
SAWarning: Table 'encryption' specifies columns 'volume_type_id'
as primary_key=True, not matching locally specified columns
'encryption_id'; setting the current primary key columns to
'encryption_id'. This warning may become an exception in a future
release.

Add new strategy for sqlite upgrade: table is renamed to temporary
name, new table is created followed by INSERT statements, and
renamed to original one.

Change-Id: I723fdadb946f6944dde03954409899a9ddc3ee0e
Closes-Bug: #1431374

commit_message:
Run pandoc to convert the documentation

This converts all MD formatted docs that were renamed to RST to
preserve git history into actual RST documentation.  Some minor
edits were made but in general the purpose of this patch is to
*only* convert the documentation not rework the documentation.
I do plan on reworking the documentation in further patch sets.

All links were tested and a test rendering is available:

    http://github.com/sdake/kolla

Change-Id: I3df430b14df1ede15407c7f4ba7afcbdc6f9d757

AUFS requires CONFIG\_AUFS\_XATTR=y set when building the kernel. On Ubuntu, versions prior to 3.19 did not set that flag. If you are unable to upgrade your kernel, you should use a different storage backend such as btrfs.:: Finally stop libvirt on the host machine. Only one copy of libvirt may be running at a time. ::The basic starting environment will be created using ``ansible``. This environment will start up the OpenStack services listed in the inventory file. A virtual machine takes five minutes to deploy AIO. These are estimates; your hardware mayDebugging Kolla ---------------:: ::

commit_message:
Prepare for MD to RST conversion

Sphinx and OpenStack documentation standards require the use of
RST formatted documentation.  In order to get out docs integrated
into docs.openstack.org, the following steps must be taken:

1. we need to first convert the documentation to RST
2. sphinx support must be added to the repository
3. project-config must be updated with a publish-docs job

The ability to pubish to docs.openstack.org is a privilege only
available to Big Tent projects.  As a result, we should be taking
advantage of this to help spread the word on our implementation.

Note the documentation was converted with a tool called pandoc
the syntax of which was:
pandoc -f markdown -t rst file.md > z
mv z file.rst

In order for git to preserve history the files have to be git mv'ed
in one commit followed by the pandoc operation in a separate commit.

Change-Id: Iba2a70b989e8305da03e8204a9b130d457b00cf0

commit_message:
Avoid recording whole instance info in log

Several compute pollsters will record the whole instance info in log when
polling resources usage, it is redundant and may boom the log messages.

Closes-Bug: #1487261
Change-Id: I308254eb1e63d1215c1c053aaf88093aa937df0b

commit_message:
Add options for selective build and listing images

New flag added: -l for listing available images. Positional arguments
have been also added to select specific images to build. Currently the
specific images must contain all dependencies (in any order) of the
restricted build set. Example usage:

./build.py -l
./build.py -T 1 rabbitmq base

or

./build.py --template -l
./build.py --template -T 1 base heat-engine heat-base

Change-Id: Id988a116c214dca50347ef039c2630d998f381ed
Partially-Implements: blueprint build-script
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/23/215323/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(jpeeler): Add automatic dependency building when specific images are # specified (--images option) parser.add_argument('-i', '--images', help='String of image names to build. ', default=None) parser.add_argument('-l', '--list', help='List available image names', action='store_true', default=None) def buildImageList(self, build_image_list): if build_image_list: paths_to_walk = [path for path in self.docker_build_paths if os.path.basename(path) in build_image_list.split(" ")] else: paths_to_walk = self.docker_build_paths # Walk Dockerfiles and replace the %%KOLLA%% variables for path in paths_to_walk: def buildQueues(self, build_image_list): self.buildImageList(build_image_list) pools = kolla.buildQueues(args['images']) if args['list']: # would be nice to have dependency info printed visually print('Available images to build:') for image in kolla.images: print image['name'] kolla.cleanup() sys.exit(0)
deleted_lines: def buildImageList(self): # Walk all of the Dockerfiles and replace the %%KOLLA%% variables for path in self.docker_build_paths: def buildQueues(self): self.buildImageList() pools = kolla.buildQueues()

commit_message:
Fix Keystone CLI

Given keystone CLI is being deprecated to use openstack,
updating the Managing projects chapter to reflect the new CLI.
Changed keystone tenant-list to openstack project list.

Change-Id: I0ec1b35cff592157200118877b71d68de0e78106
Closes-Bug: #1486657

commit_message:
Specify NIC option for nova boot

Choose first network from networks list and specify
it for nova boot. Otherwise nova can not boot instance
when more then one network available.

Change-Id: I4813f6fff3050e2141e3a5e8eb4d7d8919721703

commit_message:
Sync FK constraints in db models with migration scripts

We do have a functional test that compares Neutron's db models with
migration scripts. The comparison is based on alembic library that had a
bug which is gonna be solved in the next release [1]. Once we start
using newer alembic, functional test mentioned above will start failing
due to models and scripts are not in sync.

This patch adds needed constraints discovered by running functional test
locally with dev version of alembic.

Note: There is already a patch [2] that fixes QoS.

[1] https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/alembic/issues/317
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/214215/

Change-Id: I0d0bddb05f543365d09e592bd81759534de49367
Closes-Bug: 1486936

subject: Add Ceph/RBD support to playbooks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-10 13:23:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/fc254fbc71d103fbfa03d6bfd19ad46482a1bb4c', 'message': 'Add Ceph/RBD support to playbooks

Currently the playbooks do not allow Ceph to be configured as a backend
for Cinder, Glance or Nova. This commit adds a new role called
ceph_client to do the required configuration of the hosts and updates
the service roles to include the required configuration file changes.
This commit requires that a Ceph cluster already exists and does not
make any changes to that cluster.

ceph_client role, run on the OpenStack service hosts
  - configures the Ceph apt repo
  - installs any required Ceph dependencies
  - copies the ceph.conf file and appropriate keyring file to /etc/ceph
  - creates the necessary libvirt secrets

os_glance role
glance-api.conf will set the following variables for Ceph:
  - [DEFAULT]/show_image_direct_url
  - [glance_store]/stores
  - [glance_store]/rbd_store_pool
  - [glance_store]/rbd_store_user
  - [glance_store]/rbd_store_ceph_conf
  - [glance_store]/rbd_store_chunk_size

os_nova role
nova.conf will set the following variables for Ceph:
  - [libvirt]/rbd_user
  - [libvirt]/rbd_secret_uuid
  - [libvirt]/images_type
  - [libvirt]/images_rbd_pool
  - [libvirt]/images_rbd_ceph_conf
  - [libvirt]/inject_password
  - [libvirt]/inject_key
  - [libvirt]/inject_partition
  - [libvirt]/live_migration_flag

os_cinder is not updated because ceph is defined as a backend and that
is generated from a dictionary of the config, for an example backend
config, see etc/openstack_deploy/openstack_user_config.yml.example

pw-token-gen.py is updated so that variables ending in uuid are assigned
a UUID.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint ceph-block-devices
Closes-Bug: #1455238

Currently the playbooks do not allow Ceph to be configured as a backend
for Cinder, Glance or Nova. This commit adds a new role called
ceph_client to do the required configuration of the hosts and updates
the service roles to include the required configuration file changes.
This commit requires that a Ceph cluster already exists and does not
make any changes to that cluster.

ceph_client role, run on the OpenStack service hosts
  - configures the Ceph apt repo
  - installs any required Ceph dependencies
  - copies the ceph.conf file and appropriate keyring file to /etc/ceph
  - creates the necessary libvirt secrets

os_glance role
glance-api.conf will set the following variables for Ceph:
  - [DEFAULT]/show_image_direct_url
  - [glance_store]/stores
  - [glance_store]/rbd_store_pool
  - [glance_store]/rbd_store_user
  - [glance_store]/rbd_store_ceph_conf
  - [glance_store]/rbd_store_chunk_size

os_nova role
nova.conf will set the following variables for Ceph:
  - [libvirt]/rbd_user
  - [libvirt]/rbd_secret_uuid
  - [libvirt]/images_type
  - [libvirt]/images_rbd_pool
  - [libvirt]/images_rbd_ceph_conf
  - [libvirt]/inject_password
  - [libvirt]/inject_key
  - [libvirt]/inject_partition
  - [libvirt]/live_migration_flag

os_cinder is not updated because ceph is defined as a backend and that
is generated from a dictionary of the config, for an example backend
config, see etc/openstack_deploy/openstack_user_config.yml.example

pw-token-gen.py is updated so that variables ending in uuid are assigned
a UUID.

commit_message:
Add Ceph/RBD support to playbooks

Currently the playbooks do not allow Ceph to be configured as a backend
for Cinder, Glance or Nova. This commit adds a new role called
ceph_client to do the required configuration of the hosts and updates
the service roles to include the required configuration file changes.
This commit requires that a Ceph cluster already exists and does not
make any changes to that cluster.

ceph_client role, run on the OpenStack service hosts
  - configures the Ceph apt repo
  - installs any required Ceph dependencies
  - copies the ceph.conf file and appropriate keyring file to /etc/ceph
  - creates the necessary libvirt secrets

os_glance role
glance-api.conf will set the following variables for Ceph:
  - [DEFAULT]/show_image_direct_url
  - [glance_store]/stores
  - [glance_store]/rbd_store_pool
  - [glance_store]/rbd_store_user
  - [glance_store]/rbd_store_ceph_conf
  - [glance_store]/rbd_store_chunk_size

os_nova role
nova.conf will set the following variables for Ceph:
  - [libvirt]/rbd_user
  - [libvirt]/rbd_secret_uuid
  - [libvirt]/images_type
  - [libvirt]/images_rbd_pool
  - [libvirt]/images_rbd_ceph_conf
  - [libvirt]/inject_password
  - [libvirt]/inject_key
  - [libvirt]/inject_partition
  - [libvirt]/live_migration_flag

os_cinder is not updated because ceph is defined as a backend and that
is generated from a dictionary of the config, for an example backend
config, see etc/openstack_deploy/openstack_user_config.yml.example

pw-token-gen.py is updated so that variables ending in uuid are assigned
a UUID.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint ceph-block-devices
Closes-Bug: #1455238
Change-Id: Ie484ce0bbb93adc53c30be32f291aa5058b20028
(cherry picked from commit b878370a0b3f0bbd47bff98f3fa4552f7cf66c05)

commit_message:
Reuse option for build.py

Adds flag to build.py script to reuse existing images if present.
This adds effective retry mechanism or allows to prebuild certain
images in custom way (for example base images)

Change-Id: Ie490fedfc4f0f8f56665f9905b00e66ac645b78d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/95/211495/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if image['status'] == 'reuse': print('Reusing existing:', image['name']) return parser.add_argument('-R', '--reuse', help='Do not build images if present in docker images', action='store_true', default=False) self.reuse = args['reuse'] self.dc = docker.Client(**docker.utils.kwargs_from_env()) if image['status'] not in ("built", "reuse"): if self.reuse: images_present = list() for image in self.dc.images(): images_present.extend(image['RepoTags']) if self.reuse and image['fullname'] in images_present: image['status'] = "reuse" else: image['status'] = "unprocessed"

useful for container development

commit_message:
Switched npm-run-test to npm-test

In order to clarify usage of the npm lifecycle, rather than commands
defined in OpenStack's Common Testing Interface, the npm-run-test
command has been switched to use the npm-lifecycle macro rather than
the npm-run macro.

Change-Id: I2a257159e627d76e52fe5d02c37776e3a8c7f8e7

commit_message:
Change "max_retries" to "max_polling_attempts" on OneView driver spec

This patch changes the "max_retries" variable added in ironic.conf to
"max_polling_attempts". The "max_retries" name can imply that the driver
will retry the action, but actually it references to max attempts of
connection with OneView to check if something changed regarding a resource.

Change-Id: If1cc6312b49e1aae4190d8671facfddf787676a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/68/215168/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - max_polling_attempts: Max connection attempts to check changes on OneView https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-oneviewclient
deleted_lines: - max_retries: Max connection retries to check changes on OneView https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-oneviewclient

subject: Added npm default config.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-09 18:32:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/eslint-config-openstack/commit/0d2fe0704e5b78532fffb21faff6eaf3a348d426', 'message': 'Added npm default config, plus release assist scripts.

This patch adds two pieces. First, it adds a configuration file
that clears the version prefix for tagging, and enables automatic
git tag signatures. Secondly, it adds three assistance commands
to support the generation and pushing of release tags. These
commands are:

`npm run release-major`
`npm run release-minor`
`npm run release-patch`

Change-Id: If7679f579b52633911bc5d6ee1f46dfae0104754
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-10 19:55:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/eslint-config-openstack/commit/104aa7fb66347fea4680dfd7dcb062d332d01071', 'message': "Added npm default config.

This patch adds an npmrc configuration file, which clears the

commit_message:
Added npm default config.

This patch adds an npmrc configuration file, which clears the
default version tagging prefix. This brings this project in line
with the standard tagging method used in openstack, rather than
'v1.0.0', it will use '1.0.0' as the tag. It also forces npm to
attempt to gpg-sign any tags created via `npm version`.

Change-Id: If7679f579b52633911bc5d6ee1f46dfae0104754

commit_message:
Add EnvironmentDescription, pass it down

* The EnvironmentDescription class describes an entire fullstack
  environment (as opposed to the currently implemented host-only
  descriptions). This will allow future patches to signify that a test
  should set up an environment that supports tunneling, l2pop, QoS and
  more.
* Now, most fullstack fixtures (config and process ones, at least),
  expect both the EnvironmentDescription for the current test and the
  HostDescription for the 'host' the config/process is on. This allows
  for easier and most robust future changes, as now adding a new
  parameter to one of the description objects doesn't mean adding that
  argument to a number of other objects which are using it.
* Changed HostDescription's default argument of l3_agent to False, since
  adding new configurations and defualting them to True forces the
  author to go through ALL the tests and explicitly turn them on/off.
  However, defaulting new configurations to False only requires
  explicitly turning them on, which we ought to do anyway.

Change-Id: Ib2f12016ba4371bfda76c82e11d0794acc759955

commit_message:
Add request_specs table to nova_api database

In order to take full advantage of the persisted request spec and be
able to use it in cells v2 as part of the build process it needs to be
storable in the nova_api db.  This adds the table to the nova_api db.

WIP: There is no mechanism to switch between databases yet so this
depends on that coming to fruition.  That piece is in progress by
another developer.

Change-Id: Ibb044185064240d920c1a4f2861b3aa7da247796
Implements: bp persist-request-spec

commit_message:
Add sleep for ext config, refactor bootstrap_admin config

This unbinds the waiting period for enabling external configuration
of Fuel Master and fuelmenu. Now after fuelmenu runs (enabled or
not), there is an optional 3000s sleep that is activated when Fuel
is installed with wait_for_external_config=yes as a kernel parameter.

This new workflow expects fuel-qa scripts to ssh in, check for
process named "wait_for_external_config" and then to run
"pkill -f wait_for_external_config"

Also refactored showmenu option to use a new config file
/etc/fuel/bootstrap_admin_node.conf.

Change-Id: I08686ced0b43ed35c5fcbbe4d2c9102b3483ee0b
Partial-Bug: #1461052
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/49/214749/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: wait_for_external_config=$wait_for_external_config# Run fuel menu # Pause during bootstrap_admin_node to wait for external config [ -z "$wait_for_external_config" ] && wait_for_external_config="no" # Prepare bootstrap_admin_node config cat > /etc/fuel/bootstrap_admin_node.conf << EOFshowmenu=${showmenu} wait_for_external_config=${wait_for_external_config}

commit_message:
Exclude the tap device from the default list for the Network checks.

On some Nova machines thousands of tap devices are made and are
generally not useful to monitor. Rather the libvirt plugin retrieves
network metrics for the vms which correlate to a specific nova id.
These network names large come from Open vSwitch

commit_message:
Added missing configuration to horizon docker template.

Added missing copy and link commands:
 && cp -r /horizon/openstack_dashboard /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/ \
 && cp /horizon/openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example \
     /etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings \
 && ln -s /etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings \
     /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py \
 && cp /horizon/manage.py /usr/share/openstack-dashboard \
 && python /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/manage.py collectstatic --noinput \

Changed 'mkdir -p /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/static' to 'mkdir -p /usr/share/openstack-dashboard'

Change-Id: Ia79c43d771ab2b3628112a9c4d0e6bb2d3348f4f
Closes-Bug: 1487028

commit_message:
Change link to UI on upgrades

When we upgrade from old releases without link to https
for UI in /etc/issue, we should change protocol and port
values manually.

Change-Id: I761d81f05deba70822ecd3a0a50c4c37e1068557
Partial-Bug: #1485995
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/77/214177/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Change link to UI on upgrades from old releases exec { "Change protocol and port in in issue": path => '/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin', command => "sed -e 's|http://\(.*\):8000\(.*\)|https://\1:8443\2|g' /etc/issue", }

commit_message:
MemoryUnit Incorrectly normalizes to uppercase

As per GNU standard, modified scalar units dictionary in utils.py.
Validating scalar unit size and if not followed GNU standard,
converting given scalar unit to GNU standard value after displaying
a warning message.

Modified scalar unit dictionaries in scalarunit.py
Added validation for scalar input unit
Added testcases in test_utils.py

Modified the code to avoid displaying warning message multiple times

Change-Id: Ie038e797f0bedb5da8f97e0f4688b961242b9015
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-translator refs/changes/71/211971/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: UNIT_SIZE_DICT = {'B': 1, 'kB': 1000, 'KiB': 1024, 'MB': 1000000, 'MiB': 1048576, 'GB': 1000000000, 'GiB': 1073741824, 'TB': 1000000000000, 'TiB': 1099511627776} unit = MemoryUnit.validate_unit(unit) unit_size = MemoryUnit.validate_unit(result[1]) * MemoryUnit.UNIT_SIZE_DICT[unit_size] [unit], -1)) if unit in MemoryUnit.UNIT_SIZE_DICT.keys(): return unit else: for key in MemoryUnit.UNIT_SIZE_DICT.keys(): if key.upper() == unit.upper(): logging.warning(_('Given unit %(unit)s is not following' ' GNU standards.') % {'unit': unit}) unit_size = key return unit_size msg = _('Provided unit "{0}" is not valid. The valid units are' ' {1}').format(unit, MemoryUnit.UNIT_SIZE_DICT.keys()) raise ValueError(msg)
deleted_lines: UNIT_SIZE_DICT = {'B': 1, 'KB': 1000, 'KIB': 1024, 'MB': 1000000, 'MIB': 1048576, 'GB': 1000000000, 'GIB': 1073741824, 'TB': 1000000000000, 'TIB': 1099511627776} MemoryUnit.validate_unit(unit) MemoryUnit.validate_unit(result[1]) * MemoryUnit.UNIT_SIZE_DICT[result[1].upper()] [unit.upper()], -1)) if unit.upper() not in MemoryUnit.UNIT_SIZE_DICT.keys(): msg = _('Provided unit "{0}" is not valid. The valid units are ' '{1}').format(unit, MemoryUnit.UNIT_SIZE_DICT.keys()) raise ValueError(msg)

commit_message:
Increase the concurrency of software-config functional test

The test now creates up to 10 deployments in various stack/deployment
resource combinations and asserts that the resulting server metadata
has the appropriate number of resources.

This test now creates a deployment via OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments as
the extra nested stack is required to trigger the race causing bug #1477329

Related-Bug: #1477329
Change-Id: Id3d5b09def6d03bca669c1ab0751641b72f61ce4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/63/210963/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import yaml server_template = '''outputs: server: value: {get_resource: server} ''' config_template = ''' heat_template_version: "2013-05-23" parameters: server: type: string resources: deployment_snippet = ''' type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment properties: config: {get_resource: config} server: {get_param: server} ''' enable_cleanup = True self.client = self.orchestration_client def test_deployments_metadata(self): template=self.server_template, enable_cleanup=self.enable_cleanup) server_stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) server = server_stack.outputs[0]['output_value'] self.deploy_config(server, 10) self.assert_deployment_count(server_stack, 10) config_stacks = [] # add 10 stacks each with 2 deployments for a in range(10): config_stacks.append( self.deploy_config(server, 2)) self.assert_deployment_count(server_stack, 30) def deploy_config(self, server, deploy_count): parms = {'server': server} template = yaml.safe_load(self.config_template) resources = template['resources'] for a in range(deploy_count): resources['dep_%s' % a] = yaml.safe_load(self.deployment_snippet) stack = self.stack_create( parameters=parms, template=template, enable_cleanup=self.enable_cleanup, expected_status=None) for a in range(deploy_count): dep_name = 'dep_%s' % a self._wait_for_resource_status(stack, dep_name, 'CREATE_IN_PROGRESS', wait_for_physical_resource=True) def assert_deployment_count(self, server_stack, count): server_metadata = self.client.resources.metadata(server_stack.id, 'server') self.assertEqual(count, len(server_metadata['deployments']))
deleted_lines: template = ''' dep1: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment properties: config: {get_resource: config} server: {get_resource: server} signal_transport: NO_SIGNAL dep2: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment properties: config: {get_resource: config} server: {get_resource: server} signal_transport: NO_SIGNAL dep3: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment properties: config: {get_resource: config} server: {get_resource: server} signal_transport: NO_SIGNAL dep4: type: OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment properties: config: {get_resource: config} server: {get_resource: server} signal_transport: NO_SIGNAL def test_fail(self): template=self.template) stack = self.client.stacks.get(stack_identifier) server_metadata = self.client.resources.metadata(stack.id, 'server') self.assertEqual(4, len(server_metadata['deployments']))

subject: Allow a log dir that isn't the "service_name"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-21 12:37:05.000000000', 'files': ['etc/openstack_deploy/env.d/galera.yml', 'playbooks/roles/lxc_container_create/tasks/container_create.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/5bd6ef9ba5cc2f23507d353c2a4fedafa3b50f91', 'message': 'Allow a log dir that isn't the "service_name"

Galera logs by default to /var/log/mysql_logs these logs are being
ignored and not mounted properly on the host server, because the
service_name that is used to mount the log directory is "galera" and not
"mysql_logs".

This patch adds an option to set the log_directory specifically inside
the env.d yml files, but defaults to "service_name" when the
log_directory option isn't set. This will mean functionality remains
unchanged for all services.

Additionally, the log_directory has changed to "mysql_logs" for galera
containers, to resolve the galera log issue.

Change-Id: I18400248da455156dbba31b9c2ff254b58c51673
Closes-Bug: #1486955
(cherry picked from commit f77cc7a861117b5fe1a0993bd848b26cd47a385a)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow a log dir that isn't the "service_name"

Galera logs by default to /var/log/mysql_logs these logs are being
ignored and not mounted properly on the host server, because the
service_name that is used to mount the log directory is "galera" and not
"mysql_logs".

This patch adds an option to set the log_directory specifically inside
the env.d yml files, but defaults to "service_name" when the
log_directory option isn't set. This will mean functionality remains
unchanged for all services.

Additionally, the log_directory has changed to "mysql_logs" for galera
containers, to resolve the galera log issue.

Change-Id: I18400248da455156dbba31b9c2ff254b58c51673
Closes-Bug: #1486955
(cherry picked from commit f77cc7a861117b5fe1a0993bd848b26cd47a385a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/02/215602/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: mkdir -p /var/log/{{ properties.service_name }} - "lxc.mount.entry=/openstack/log/{{ inventory_hostname }} var/log/{{ properties.service_name }} none defaults,bind,rw 0 0"

commit_message:
Bump pbr version to match g-r

update the min pbr version to prevent problems with some of
the oslo libraries where we specify conditions like the
following in requirements.txt
python_version=='2.7'

commit_message:
Add required packages to Developer Quick-Start guide

Add required packages for Ubuntu(build-essential).
Without them, running tox fails due to not finding gcc.

Change-Id: I42b29ee892869efc50a8c2d1cc43876a76494e8a
Closes-Bug: #1485730

commit_message:
Add dlt media to tx_mgr

This change set adds the deletion of the VM vOpt to the transaction
manager.  This helps with the mass concurrent delete flow.  It speeds up
the delete and enables for more resiliancy.

Change-Id: I6ffea97c8e6d6b20a37dc1ec9624f3f24cb0b411

commit_message:
Prepare for gating by distro, type, docker type

We will gate on all combos of:
/docker
/docker_templates
Centos
Ubuntu
Binary
Source

Except for Ubuntu + Binary because there is no delorean
style repository for Ubuntu.

Change-Id: Ic1ed8c22c2f86ff339299939da9ac492a7c7c5f5
Partially-Impelements: blueprint gate-source-builds

commit_message:
freezer-agent support for keystone v2.0 and v3

The freezer-agent now supports authentication using keystone
versions 2.0 and 3.

Adds the folllowing cli parameter:

  --os-identity-api-version <version>

which is intended to take the place of the deprecated --os-auth-ver
The identity api version can be passed using the environ variable:

  OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION

Implements blueprint: agent-identity-api-version

Change-Id: Ia9a299d379acccfffc62bd6112fd533d176ac66c

commit_message:
Remove httpchk option from haproxy listeners

To make sure we don't use the ssl-hello-chk option set by the
puppet-haproxy module we used to redefine the listener options
for all listeners.

With this change a default for the options hash is provided to
the puppet class instead.

This change also configures use of tcpka only where wanted, as
documented by [1], removing it from the haproxy defaults section,
given it wasn't used anyway by the other listeners which were
indeed overriding options.

1. https://github.com/beekhof/osp-ha-deploy/blob/master/pcmk/lb.scenario

Change-Id: Ic8deb77533f561cea7ce7db1d20f6be5e2dc0d33

commit_message:
Added gcc in OS-specific prerequisites

Once magnum is cloned on fedora 21 and when tox is run, it breaks
while installing dependencies. Installing gcc fixes the issue

Closes-Bug: #1486035

Change-Id: I44734b5490585afac23c63ae84c9e8a1d30c828c

commit_message:
Restore sorting by format for murano packages

Currently Format column is empty, due to yaml format change
This commit points Format column towards service.format and patches
service.format for bundle files as part of bundle format introduction

Change-Id: Ic92752da09caaac1e65d87782a8f525590704397
Closes-Bug: #1485072

commit_message:
Fix for duplicate ID's on backup metadata

freezer agent was not sending the next values to the api
fixed time_stamp values for id
fixed current_level values for id
fixed max_level values for id

Change-Id: Ib3b12674fba5036dffe67c362093baec90417117

commit_message:
Authentication URLs and endpoint clarity re-factor

Admin endpoint is used to build os-url as fail back when they're no others
URL available for authenticating. The legacy code was confusing and entangled between
endpoint discovery and auth_url and os_url (service token) assignments.
This brings better readability with:
- Re-factors by clearly separating url and endpoints methods.
- Makes sure the API version is present when using the service_url (os-url) for
user password validation.

Change-Id: Ibca33c38e78d4b26c7b842d8b7d97db46c3c9734

commit_message:
full multi-meter support

this patch adds ability to define multi-value jsonpath for all attributes
(not including source, timestamp, metadata).

NOTE: we will not remove the telemetry meter because we don't want to
allow user ability to (inadvertantly) remove support for pollster/api.

Change-Id: I5151ea7f3bede643830bbe8c01540628bc619f21
Implements: blueprint declarative-notifications

commit_message:
Introduce Guru Meditation Reports into Ceilometer

This commit integrates functionality from the `openstack.common.report`
module into Ceilometer. This enables Ceilometer services to receive
SIGUSR1 and print a Guru Meditation Report to stderr or file.
The required modules were added to 'openstack-common.conf' as well.

Change-Id: Ic59c08a610dff7140f14304a60f1c3297d190239
Implements: blueprint guru-meditation-report
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/69/196369/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Copyright (c) 2014 OpenStack Foundation Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. Guru Meditation Reports ======================= Ceilometer contains a mechanism whereby developers and system administrators can generate a report about the state of a running Ceilometer executable. This report is called a *Guru Meditation Report* (*GMR* for short). Generating a GMR ---------------- A *GMR* can be generated by sending the *USR1* signal to any Ceilometer process with support (see below). The *GMR* will then be outputted standard error for that particular process. For example, suppose that ``ceilometer-polling`` has process id ``8675``, and was run with ``2>/var/log/ceilometer/ceilometer-polling.log``. Then, ``kill -USR1 8675`` will trigger the Guru Meditation report to be printed to ``/var/log/ceilometer/ceilometer-polling.log``. Structure of a GMR ------------------ The *GMR* is designed to be extensible; any particular executable may add its own sections. However, the base *GMR* consists of several sections: Package Shows information about the package to which this process belongs, including version information Threads Shows stack traces and thread ids for each of the threads within this process Green Threads Shows stack traces for each of the green threads within this process (green threads don't have thread ids) Configuration Lists all the configuration options currently accessible via the CONF object for the current process Adding Support for GMRs to New Executables ------------------------------------------ Adding support for a *GMR* to a given executable is fairly easy. First import the module (currently residing in oslo-incubator), as well as the Ceilometer version module: .. code-block:: python from Ceilometer.openstack.common.report import guru_meditation_report as gmr from Ceilometer import version Then, register any additional sections (optional): .. code-block:: python TextGuruMeditation.register_section('Some Special Section', some_section_generator) Finally (under main), before running the "main loop" of the executable (usually ``service.server(server)`` or something similar), register the *GMR* hook: .. code-block:: python TextGuruMeditation.setup_autorun(version) Extending the GMR ----------------- As mentioned above, additional sections can be added to the GMR for a particular executable. For more information, see the inline documentation under :mod:`ceilometer.openstack.common.report`

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-20 02:09:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/db9ebc6ebb4a459aead88bf98119d5f79db8ab94', 'message': "lxc: fix disk_info passed to _create_domain_and_network in _hard_reboot

Commit a7a0b4e542a65b3ba3650db2b7560eb587b9606c changed
_get_instance_disk_info to return a list rather than a json string.  As
part of that, it overwrote the local disk_info variable (which was a
dict) in _hard_reboot before it was passed to
_create_domain_and_network.  Eventually when disk_info gets down to
_create_domain_setup_lxc it fails the _is_booted_from_volume because
it's a list rather than a dict.

This moves the _get_instance_disk_info call in _hard_reboot within the
context.auth_token block since the return value is otherwise not needed,
and creates a unique local variable for the instance disk_info so it
doesn't collide with the disk_info that comes back from
blockinfo.get_disk_info.

At some point we should create objects for these various disk_info
variables because otherwise it's really confusing trying to track the
types and usage of all of these different things called 'disk_info'
which are sometimes dicts and sometimes lists of dicts.

Closes-Bug: #1370590

Co-Authored-By: Andrew Melton <andrew.melton@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: Idba5f1ec3a39b8745b6808df8731ba2ffc160898
"}]
commit_message:
lxc: fix disk_info passed to _create_domain_and_network in _hard_reboot

Commit a7a0b4e542a65b3ba3650db2b7560eb587b9606c changed
_get_instance_disk_info to return a list rather than a json string.  As
part of that, it overwrote the local disk_info variable (which was a
dict) in _hard_reboot before it was passed to
_create_domain_and_network.  Eventually when disk_info gets down to
_create_domain_setup_lxc it fails the _is_booted_from_volume because
it's a list rather than a dict.

This moves the _get_instance_disk_info call in _hard_reboot within the
context.auth_token block since the return value is otherwise not needed,
and creates a unique local variable for the instance disk_info so it
doesn't collide with the disk_info that comes back from
blockinfo.get_disk_info.

At some point we should create objects for these various disk_info
variables because otherwise it's really confusing trying to track the
types and usage of all of these different things called 'disk_info'
which are sometimes dicts and sometimes lists of dicts.

Closes-Bug: #1370590

Co-Authored-By: Andrew Melton <andrew.melton@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: Idba5f1ec3a39b8745b6808df8731ba2ffc160898
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/25/214925/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with mock.patch.object(blockinfo, 'get_disk_info', return_value=mock.sentinel.block_disk_info): drvr._hard_reboot(self.context, instance, network_info, block_device_info) # make sure that _create_images_and_backing is passed the disk_info # returned from _get_instance_disk_info and not the one that is in # scope from blockinfo.get_disk_info mock_create_images_and_backing.assert_called_once_with( self.context, instance, mock.ANY, disk_info) # make sure that _create_domain_and_network is passed the disk_info # returned from blockinfo.get_disk_info and not the one that's # returned from _get_instance_disk_info mock_create_domain_and_network.assert_called_once_with( self.context, dummyxml, instance, network_info, mock.sentinel.block_disk_info, block_device_info=block_device_info, reboot=True, vifs_already_plugged=True)

commit_message:
Return advanced VIP information in API output

This patch adds newly VIP configuration in the newly
introduced format to the API output saving the
old formatted configuration.

Change-Id: I2891f9c0e9a26776a1f39fb03e296c0631c95a10
Closes-bug: #1486543

commit_message:
Fix "{}" is not a list error for json parameter type

If json paramter `default` of nested stack is set to
[], it resets it to {} and nested resource validations
fail. This patch fixes it by allowing empty list to
passthrough.

Change-Id: I153e9a94566679c01d6ca21713233e3140769ded
Closes-Bug: #1486778

commit_message:
Fix description for "Not exact spelling"

Change the description to "There is a inapt spelling
in the file heat/README.rst(line6).
  'templates, through both an OpenStack-native ReST API and a'.
The word 'ReST' should be spelled as 'REST'."

Change-Id: Ife2a64b9414c8f7ffd22db9d113bbb0f0cad986b
Closes-Bug: #1487265

commit_message:
Add alternative way to use debugger for unittets 

Add description about how to use pdb debugger with new tox option:
"debug". This option was added to tox.ini

Change-Id: I8a8934815eb147b4bb60e4ca2f5177f2e58cce76
Co-Authored-By: Tony Wang <muyu@unitedstack.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/63/214663/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Another way to use debugger for testing is to add follow lines in your tox.ini: [testenv:debug] commands = oslo_debug_helper {posargs} And then run tox with command: $ tox -e debug

commit_message:
Create RequestSpec object

In order to clean up the interface between Nova and the Scheduler,
we need to create a RequestSpec object modeled based on
build_request_spec() and populate_filter_properties()

Partially-Implements: blueprint request-spec-object

Change-Id: I31867f93d882d7249ef9d43cd63d6f8b5f03f070

commit_message:
Unauthed tests for Secret & Container ACLs

These tests will attempt CRUD operations on Secret and Container ACLs
without valid tokens. They should all return HTTP 401s. Also added
PATCH support to the common client, and use_auth parameters to ACL
behaviors.

Change-Id: Ie753b6605ae81202a4bb473dd6f9101919f4eda5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/34/200634/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
requirement falcon-0.1.10

The latest version of falcon might not be available
in some deployment environment.

The requirement now is limited to falcon version <0.2.0

Change-Id: I9eba7758b73bc67abb7d0d120ac332316b3a1a77

commit_message:
Add an explicit test failure condition when auth_token is missing

If the loop exits "successfully" without finding auth_token, scope fall
through would result in 'extension' containing the last iteration of the
'for' loop.

This change results in that behavior explicitly failing with better
error feedback.

Change-Id: Ifa63a78d267e810fcf4adb40524613d7d8f3b5b7
(cherry picked from commit bd742151ba7f5834dc50ea1534e93040eb46aa84)
(cherry picked from commit cc746dc6f740a852bbc428f57e4502be66b3a2a6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/73/214273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: else: self.fail('keystonemiddleware.auth_token not found')

commit_message:
Add an explicit test failure condition when auth_token is missing

If the loop exits "successfully" without finding auth_token, scope fall
through would result in 'extension' containing the last iteration of the
'for' loop.

This change results in that behavior explicitly failing with better
error feedback.

Change-Id: Ifa63a78d267e810fcf4adb40524613d7d8f3b5b7
(cherry picked from commit bd742151ba7f5834dc50ea1534e93040eb46aa84)

commit_message:
Set keystone under apache mod_wsgi to MPM 6x3

This sets keystone under apache WSGI to MPM mode
limited to 6 worker processess and 3 threads
in order to share info regarding memcached
backends between the threads as well as provide
the optimal performance for high load.

This should allow us to decrease retry for
dead memcache backends and thus fix a
couple of bugs introduced by changes
that are related to multiple processes
of keystone checking memcached backends.

Partial-bug: #1480153
Related-bug: #1471318
Related-bug: #1479782

Change-Id: I01e2c74f8881d4fc208758455b6c13b64f2176c7
Co-Authored-By: Vladimir Kuklin <vkuklin@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/89/209589/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: threads => min(max($::processorcount,2), 24), workers => 1,

commit_message:
Fix list_opts test to not check all deps

The list_opts entrypoint test failed unnecessarily when the
dependencies in the packages were inconsistent. This test doesn't
need to verify that the dependencies are consistent, only that the
entrypoint is available and provides the expected function.

For the backport, I added stevedore to test-requirements.txt
because it's not in requirements.txt already.

Change-Id: I857222e0637b09f45352d9cabbdc5cac8e4fd562
(cherry picked from commit 03d6f0ce9df169f43696ecade16ec1cf4162647f)
(cherry picked from commit 5b1e18f344d6970071aa96b8b15fda51e3dd561e)
